title: 113_s1268
content: The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is defined in this section. It also defines the Compact of Free Association between the two countries. Public Law 99-658 is amended to include the Results of Compact Review. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and conditions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in certain fiscal years, payments under the Agreement will be withheld until reimbursement is made. The Agreement allows for withholding payments if Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in specific fiscal years. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing certain sections of the Agreement. Authorization of appropriations is provided for subsidizing postal services to Palau and the Marshall Islands. Authorization of appropriations is provided for subsidizing postal services to the Republic of Palau, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Federated States of Micronesia, with funds remaining available until expended. Additionally, funds are authorized for Federal entities to carry out responsibilities under the Compact of Free Association. The Compact of Free Association authorizes appropriations for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia, with funds available until expended. Section 3 of the 1954 Act is repealed, and payment schedules and fund withholding are outlined in the Agreement. "Section 1 establishes the Compact Section 211(f) Fund." The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a schedule. Additionally, a grant of $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 will be provided for the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Republic of Palau will match the contributions made by the United States. The trust fund, known as the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund, will be used for routine maintenance of capital improvement projects funded by the United States. The Government of Palau will match US contributions with $150,000 quarterly from 2014 to 2024. The fiscal consolidation fund will be implemented according to the Agreement. The fiscal consolidation fund will be implemented according to the Agreement. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. Additionally, economic assistance of $69,250,000 will be provided to Palau over the next six fiscal years. The Government of Palau will receive $69,250,000 in economic assistance over ten fiscal years, with funds provided quarterly. Additionally, infrastructure projects will be supported as outlined in the Agreement. The United States will provide $40,000,000 in grants to Palau for infrastructure projects over three fiscal years. Additionally, the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 is amended to extend a program until 2024 and clarify passport requirements. Nonimmigrants in the United States and its territories can be admitted without certain immigration restrictions if they meet specific criteria related to Palau citizenship or residency. This includes individuals who were citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and became citizens of Palau, those who acquire Palau citizenship at birth, and naturalized citizens who have been residents of Palau for at least five years. Individuals who acquire Palau citizenship at birth or through naturalization and have been residents for at least five years are permitted to work in the United States. They may establish habitual residence in a U.S. territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations. However, this does not grant them the right to establish residence for naturalization under the Immigration and Nationality Act or petition for alien benefits. Section 141(a) allows Palau citizens to work in the United States after residing for five years, but does not grant them the right to establish residence for naturalization or petition for alien benefits under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
